content:
kpshek commented on Issue #19

I opened pull request #30 to address the issues raised here. Can you all take a look at let me know if it looks good?

@robcz - Thanks for pointing out the discrepancy on the source type (string vs object) documentation typo. You mentioned that name was referenced in the source examples instead of label. I think I fixed all of those in 927d5a8. Can you let me know if I missed any?

robs16 commented on Issue #19

For clarity in the examples, you might want to use something a bit more real as it helps to illustrate intended use. Perhaps from http://www.choosingwisely.org/clinician-lists/

kpshek edited Issue #19

The source within the Card structure is defined as:

the source of the information displayed on this card.

This is ambiguous as there are likely multiple sources which could be related to a card. This could refer to:
* The service providing the card
* The primary source of guidance (ex Choosing Wisely)
* Secondary sources such as research citations

We believe that the source referenced in the Card structure should be the primary source of guidance and the documentation should clearly state this.
